commits.message:
handle errors of workspace tagged with older bit-version before ComponentID changes (#8070)

## Proposed Changes

- add a descriptive message when previously errored with "scope is
missing from a component-id...". suggest running "bit cc".
- fix `bit cc` (clear-cache) command to not throw in case the consumer
or scope failed to load.
- fix `bit init --reset-scope` to work in case the consumer failed to
load.
- add another suggestion in case the components were tagged with the old
bit-version to run `bit init --reset-scope` if other options failed.
fix(aspect-unset), mark aspect with minus in component.json if it is not there (#8060)
bump @teambit/legacy version to 1.0.585 [skip ci]
feat: treat undefined (default) as pnpm
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:teambit/bit into feat/devserver-managed-paths
bump @teambit/legacy version to 1.0.584 [skip ci]
bump teambit version to 1.3.3 [skip ci]
chore: remove managed path calculation on component add/remove (#8062)
test, add e2e-tests for importing a scope that has deleted components (#8058)

fix(scope-rename), change the id in .bitmap according to the new ComponentID (#8065)

When changing defaultScope to bitmap components, update the ids of the
.bitmap entries with the new id that include the new defaultScope.

fix(node-app), utilize the AppBuildResult.metadata  (#8063)

to save the mainFile and artifactsDir into the objects.

Until now, it was saving the entire `BuildContext` object, which
includes all capsules and components objects.
fix(lanes): fix fetching historical snaps on lane from bare scope (#8064)
replace old linkModules with the new package
small refactor on ui
new pre-bundle-preview task
integrate pre-bundle-preview task to build process
integrate pre-bundle-preview into preview
use absolute path for pre-bundle-preview
bump @teambit/legacy version to 1.0.585 [skip ci]
fix(aspect-unset), mark aspect with minus in component.json if it is not there (#8060)

pull_request.title: handle errors of workspace tagged with older bit-version before ComponentID changes
pull_request.body:
## Proposed Changes

- add a descriptive message when previously errored with "scope is missing from a component-id...". suggest running "bit cc".
- fix `bit cc` (clear-cache) command to not throw in case the consumer or scope failed to load. 
- fix `bit init --reset-scope` to work in case the consumer failed to load.
- add another suggestion in case the components were tagged with the old bit-version to run `bit init --reset-scope` if other options failed.

pull_request.title: feat(Overview): onlyOverview - External Compositions and API Reference
pull_request.body:
This PR introduces a new `onlyOverview` preview option, enhancing the Overview section with a dedicated API Reference subsection and `useNameParam` preview option.

Key Features:

`onlyOverview` Preview Option:

Enabled via the preview data of a component's environment, this feature is automatically activated for all components tagged with this Bit version onwards.
It refines the Overview screen to render only the main documentation and examples within the iframe, while client-side mounting the Compositions Carousel along with the new API Reference subsection.

API Reference Subsection:

This update replaces the previous properties table, which was limited to displaying props for React components only.
The new API Reference table leverages our internal Schema Extractor (also powering the API Reference tab) to highlight the relevant APIs for your component, utilizing the @exports jsdoc tag.
By default, it presents an API Table of Contents, collating all exported APIs from the component's main file and linking them to their detailed information in the API Reference Tab.

`useNameParam` Preview Option: 

Enabled via the preview data of a component's environment, this feature is automatically activated for all components tagged with this Bit version onwards.
It sets the selected composition via name url param to view selected compositions, previously this was set with a combination of two preview options (`includesEnvTemplate` and `doesScaling`)

Compositions Order Bug Fix:

This PR also fixes the bug where the compositions were incorrectly ordered. Now all compositions are ordered according to the order they are defined.

issue.title: Bit tag no longer running bit publish and manually publishing missing dist folder
issue.body:
<!--

Before submitting a new issue, please search past issues (open or closed).  

-->

### Describe the bug

`bit tag` no longer runs bit publish and components published to npm with  `bit publish` are missing the dist folder when installed.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. `bit tag`

### Expected Behavior

During `bit tag` it should run the bit publish step and include dist folder.

### Screenshots, exceptions and logs

If applicable, add screenshots, exceptions, and logs to help explain your problem.

### Specifications

- Bit version: 1.0.0
- Workspace type: harmony
- Node version: using node v16.20.0
- npm / yarn version:(npm v8.19.4)
- Platform: Ubuntu 20

comment.body:
hi,

please see the release notes from bit 1.0.0 and the breaking changes
https://github.com/teambit/bit/releases/tag/v1.0.0

you need to add `--build` to your `tag` to run the build process, or use `--soft/--deprecate` combo in your automation.
